direct_answer.text:
To simplify each term first use the fact that any whole number divided by nine leaves either zero as remainder when it’s multiple of nine, one more unit ahead otherwise – i.e., you add up digits until reaching single digit ($modulus\;operation$) .For example :
$\begin{align} & 1=1\\ &   12=1+2=3 \; (\text {remainder}= 3 } \\&  123=1+2+3=6\;(\text { remaindter });\\ &     &\dotsb&=&\cdots; \end{align}$Now apply above mentioned strategy on terms individually:$1+12=3,$ $123=6,$ $1234=9,\quad 12345= 5.$Also observe pattern carefully:- For every consecutive increasing term - starting form second last element till third last elements ,they become added together giving sixes.- Third last element becomes five times itself due to addition of fourth last element-$123456=1+$ Remaining part equals sixth layer having fifth degree polynomial hence same rule applies here resulting adding them altogether gets us thirty three.$$Therefore\,the \,sum \,of\,all\,\

ost_step.1: Notice that any digit added or multiplied by itself ends up being equivalent to either 9 or -1 modulo 9 because those digits are just one more/less than themselves when divided by 9. For example, under modular arithmetic rules, $a \equiv b \, (\text{mod } m)$ implies $ac \equiv bc\,(\text{mod}\,m)$, so it suffices to consider each individual term separately since addition commutes: $$\begin{array}{|rcll|} 1&\equiv&1\\  12 &\equiv &1+2=3\\  123& \equiv&3+3=-1 \\  1234 & \equiv &3+4=7\\  12345 & \equiv&7+5=2\\   123456 & \equiv&2+6=8\\    1234567 & \equiv&8+5=3\\     12345678 & \equiv &3+6=9\\ \end{array}$$ Step 2: Adding together our results above yields 42; thus, adding them again does not change anything about whether something is evenly divis

subanswer.text: Upon simplifying further using modular arithmetic rules, every term contributes its digit as per positional values; therefore, considering just the unit places leads directly to calculating remainder upon division by 9. direct_answer.text:
To simplify each term first use the fact that any whole number divided by nine leaves either zero as remainder when it’s multiple of nine, one more unit ahead otherwise – i.e., you add up digits until reaching single digit ($modulus\;operation$) .For example :
$\begin{align} & 1=1\\ &   12=1+2=3 \; (\text {remainder}= 3 } \\&  123=1+2+3=6\;(\text { remaindter });\\ &     &\dotsb&=&\cdots; \end{align}$Now apply above mentioned strategy on terms individually:$1+12=3,$ $123=6,$ $1234=9,\quad 12345= 5.$Also observe pattern carefully:- For every consecutive increasing term - starting form second last element till third last elements ,they become added together giving sixes.- Third last element becomes five times itself due to addition of fourth last element-$123456=1+$ Remaining part equals sixth layer having fifth degree polynomial hence same rule applies here resulting adding them altogether gets us thirty three.$$Therefore\,the \,sum \,of\,all\,\
